com.incadencecorp.coalesce.services.client.common.jaxws.util

Class JAXWSUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.incadencecorp.coalesce.services.client.common.jaxws.util.JAXWSUtil

  • public final class JAXWSUtil
extends Object
    This utility class is a helper class for constructing clients and setting security credentials.
    Author:
    Derek Clemenzi

    • Method Detail

      • createClient

        public static <T> T createClient(Class<T> clazz,
                                 URL url)
        Calls createClient(Class, URL, Bus) passing null for the bus implementation.
        Parameters:
        clazz - client implementation of the WSDL
        url - to the service WSDL
        Returns:
        a JAXWS client targeting the WSDL.

      • createClient

        public static <T> T createClient(Class<T> clazz,
                                 URL url,
                                 org.apache.cxf.Bus bus)
        Creates a client using the specified bus that is used to as an argument when calling other methods in this class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - client implementation of the WSDL
        url - to the service WSDL
        bus - if null; getBus() is used to load a bus implementation.
        Returns:
        a JAXWS client targeting the WSDL.

      • createToken

        public static org.apache.cxf.ws.security.tokenstore.SecurityToken createToken(Document assertion)
                                                                       throws org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException
        Creates a Security Token from a SAML assertion.
        Parameters:
        assertion -
        Returns:
        SecurityToken
        Throws:
        org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException - if there was an issue parsing the assertion.

      • createToken

        public static org.apache.cxf.ws.security.tokenstore.SecurityToken createToken(String username,
                                                                              String password)
                                                                       throws org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException
        Creates a SecurityToken using the STS.
        Parameters:
        username - if using Kerberos this is ignored and the keytab is used instead.
        password -
        Returns:
        creates a token for the provided user.
        Throws:
        org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException

      • renewToken

        public static org.apache.cxf.ws.security.tokenstore.SecurityToken renewToken(org.apache.cxf.ws.security.tokenstore.SecurityToken token)
                                                                      throws org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException
        Defaults the user's name to RENEWER_USERNAME and the password to RENEWER_PASSWORD.
        Parameters:
        token -
        Returns:
        renewToken(SecurityToken, String, String)
        Throws:
        org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException

      • renewToken

        public static org.apache.cxf.ws.security.tokenstore.SecurityToken renewToken(org.apache.cxf.ws.security.tokenstore.SecurityToken token,
                                                                             String username,
                                                                             String password)
                                                                      throws org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException
        If token will expire in EXPIRATION_THRESHOLD seconds this method will call createOnBehalfOfToken(SecurityToken, String, String) to create a new token on behalf of the original; otherwise the original is returned.
        Parameters:
        token -
        username - must have permissions to create token on behalf of another user. If using Kerberos this is ignored and the keytab is used instead.
        password -
        Returns:
        a non-expired token.
        Throws:
        org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException

      • renewPrincipal

        public static Principal renewPrincipal(Principal principal)
                                throws org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException
        Defaults the user's name to RENEWER_USERNAME and the password to RENEWER_PASSWORD.
        Parameters:
        principal -
        Returns:
        renewPrincipal(Principal, String, String)
        Throws:
        org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException

      • renewPrincipal

        public static Principal renewPrincipal(Principal principal,
                                       String username,
                                       String password)
                                throws org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException
        If token will expire in EXPIRATION_THRESHOLD seconds this method will call renewToken(SecurityToken, String, String) to create a new token on behalf of the original; otherwise the original is returned.
        Parameters:
        principal -
        username - must have permissions to create token on behalf of another user. If using Kerberos this is ignored and the keytab is used instead.
        password -
        Returns:
        a non-expired token.
        Throws:
        org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException

      • createOnBehalfOfToken

        public static org.apache.cxf.ws.security.tokenstore.SecurityToken createOnBehalfOfToken(org.apache.cxf.ws.security.tokenstore.SecurityToken onBehalfOf)
                                                                                 throws org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException
        Defaults the user's name to RENEWER_USERNAME and the password to RENEWER_PASSWORD.
        Parameters:
        onBehalfOf -
        Returns:
        renewToken(SecurityToken, String, String)
        Throws:
        org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException

      • createOnBehalfOfToken

        public static org.apache.cxf.ws.security.tokenstore.SecurityToken createOnBehalfOfToken(org.apache.cxf.ws.security.tokenstore.SecurityToken onBehalfOf,
                                                                                        String username,
                                                                                        String password)
                                                                                 throws org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException
        Creates a SecurityToken using the STS on the behalf of another user.
        Parameters:
        onBehalfOf - SAML assertion of the user to create the token for. This assertion can be expired.
        username - must have permissions to create token on behalf of another user. If using Kerberos this is ignored and the keytab is used instead.
        password -
        Returns:
        creates a token on behalf of another token through the STS.
        Throws:
        org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException

      • createOnBehalfOfToken

        public static org.apache.cxf.ws.security.tokenstore.SecurityToken createOnBehalfOfToken(String onBehalfOf)
                                                                                 throws org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException,
                                                                                        ParserConfigurationException
        Defaults the user's name to RENEWER_USERNAME and the password to RENEWER_PASSWORD.
        Parameters:
        onBehalfOf -
        Returns:
        renewToken(SecurityToken, String, String)
        Throws:
        org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException
        ParserConfigurationException

      • createOnBehalfOfToken

        public static org.apache.cxf.ws.security.tokenstore.SecurityToken createOnBehalfOfToken(String onBehalfOf,
                                                                                        String username,
                                                                                        String password)
                                                                                 throws org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException,
                                                                                        ParserConfigurationException
        Creates a SecurityToken using the STS on the behalf of another user.
        Parameters:
        onBehalfOf - of the user to create the token for.
        username - must have permissions to create token on behalf of another user. If using Kerberos this is ignored and the keytab is used instead.
        password -
        Returns:
        creates a token on behalf of the specified user's id.
        Throws:
        org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException
        ParserConfigurationException

                                  String userId,
                                  String password)
        Deprecated. Not thread safe
        Sets the credentials to use for authenticating with the service.
        Parameters:
        client - client created from createClient(Class, URL).
        userId - if using Kerberos this is ignored and the keytab is used instead.
        password -

        Clears the user's credentials.
        Parameters:

      • getBus

        public static org.apache.cxf.Bus getBus()
        Attempts to use dependency injection to load the Bus from an OSGi container. If running outside of Karaf or a Bus is not provided by the container it will use the XXXXX file to create the Bus from a Spring configuration file.
        Returns:
        null if there is no bus configured otherwise the bus to be used by the clients.

                                                                            throws org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException
        Creates a principle from a provided token.
        Parameters:
        token -
        Returns:
        a SAML Token Principal that can be used to authenticate.
        Throws:
        org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException
